instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
threads.message:
Hello
I have this clean board stuck on 5V

-USBC1 takes 0.165A
-USBC2 takes 0.145A

Not sure how to start with this M1.

What is the equivalent to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?

<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL>: 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> voltage?
If not, check <RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
threads.message:
Replaced <CHIP>U5700</CHIP> and the board takes now 20V 0.200A when connected to UF500.

When connected to UF400 only 5V and the USB-C meter restarts. 

Any idea? Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
threads.message:
Do you get same voltages on UF400/500 chips?

The logic part of UF400 is OK, as it boots first (from TBT ROM).
UF500 boots from UART lines connected to UF400.
Check and compare diode mode readings between CC1/2 lines.
Also check all resistors from pages 57 & 58.
On page 59, compare diode mode between USB-C lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
threads.message:
Couldnt find any different measurement on the chips.

I replaced UF400 and the machine taking 20V y both ports.

Now, when connecting the screen I only get 5V on both ports. If I disconnect the screen I can hear it chimes.
I took out the board again and on the bench i do get external video

Any help?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
threads.message:
I have <SIGNAL>PP5V_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> shorted to ground when connecting the screen (0 ohms)

When screen disconnected I got 58ohms to ground or 0.064V (diode mode) 

-Any recommendation on the screen? 

-The 0.064V sounds good?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Stuck 5V
threads.message:
Then you must change the screen.

I don't have comparison board for <SIGNAL>5V_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>.
